meanings.definition: The belief in the existence of monads as the ultimate units of reality.
meanings.sent1: In monadism, monads are seen as the basic building blocks of everything.
meanings.sent2: Some philosophers find comfort in the idea of monadism and its focus on ultimate units.
meanings.sent3: The concept of monadism can make you rethink what you consider real.
meanings.sent4: Exploring monadism is like peeling layers to reveal the core of existence.
meanings.sent5: Studying monadism is like unraveling the fabric of reality to find the threads of monads.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that the universe consists of simple, indivisible units.
meanings.sent1: Monadism suggests that the universe is made up of indivisible units.
meanings.sent2: Scientists debate the validity of monadism and its view of the universe.
meanings.sent3: Thinking about monadism can lead to some interesting cosmic ponderings.
meanings.sent4: The idea of monadism paints the universe as a giant puzzle of simple pieces.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monadism simplifies the complexity of the universe into basic units.

meanings.definition: The philosophical theory that all things can be reduced to a single, simple substance.
meanings.sent1: In monadism, everything is believed to stem from a single substance.
meanings.sent2: Some thinkers find solace in the unity proposed by monadism.
meanings.sent3: The notion of monadism can lead to some deep contemplation on simplicity.
meanings.sent4: The essence of monadism is like distilling the essence of all things into one.
meanings.sent5: The philosophy of monadism simplifies the complexity of existence into a single substance.
